snippet: The lofty price Microsoft paid AOL for 800 patents — $1.3 million each — reflects the crucial role patents are playing in the business and legal strategies of technology companies.
abstract: Microsoft's $1.056 billion purchase of 800 patents held by AOL intensifies a global battle for intellectual property between the world's major technology companies; price significantly exceeds market predictions; sale reflects the particular importance of patents related to the lucrative smartphone and tablet computer industries.

byline.contributor: Michael J. de la Merced contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The lofty price Microsoft paid AOL for 800 patents — $1.3 million each — reflects the crucial role patents are playing in the business and legal strategies of technology companies.

headline.seo: Microsoft to Buy AOL Patents for More Than $1 Billion
headline.main: Microsoft’s AOL Deal Intensifies Patent Wars
